items.sentence: I used to watch TV at least three hours every day.
I can't believe Tom did all this without any help.
All the girls in Tom's class are in love with him.
The names on this list are in no particular order.
Even if I were rich, I wouldn't give money to Tom.
You look like you could use another pair of hands.
I was able to solve this problem without any help.
The assignment took me longer than I had expected.
I suspect Tom and Mary are more than just friends.
I suspect Tom and Mary both have houses in Boston.
I can't believe that Tom and I are really married.
I don't think that Tom knows I used to be married.
I'd rather go to the dance with you than with Tom.
You said Tom wouldn't kiss me, but you were wrong.
Tom and I got married in a small church in Boston.
Where do you usually go when you want to be alone?
Some people like red wine, others like white wine.
Tom says many young people don't like blues music.
Tom wants people to stop asking so many questions.
Tom hasn't talked to Mary since they got divorced.
